title: Foreign investors rejig offshore structures to satisfy Indian tax rules

title: Adani Group plans up to 1.5 billion yen fundraising from Japan after rating upgrade

Japanese investors offer long maturities, benefiting infrastructure-heavy groups.

title: No FDs please: Indian households' financial savings strategy changes
summary: Indian households are increasingly investing in equities and market-linked instruments. This shift marks a significant change from traditional bank deposits. Developing the debt market is the next step for a robust financial system.

summary: From a valuation perspective, the market has already gone through a phase of underperformance driven by high starting valuations and a limited margin of safety, said Dharmesh Kakkad, Senior Fund Manager, ICICI Prudential AMC.

title: Q3 earnings: Dixon hit by mobile slowdown, Syrma turns cash flow positive
summary: India's top EMS companies saw diverging fortunes as mobile pressure weighed on Dixon and exports boosted Syrma's earnings.

title: Paytm braces for near-term Ebitda impact as digital payment infra incentive lapses
summary: The PIDF incentive, which contributed  ₹216 crore over the nine months ended December 2025, expired in December and will not recur. Paytm will also have to shield tax on other income from the coming financial year, analysts said.

title: Ambuja Cements Q3: Profit slumps 91% YoY to Rs 204 crore; revenue jumps 20%
summary: Ambuja's volume growth was 2X the industry average, with a higher focus on trade sales/premium cement, which delivered better realisations than peers, along with higher volume growth of base capacity. The total cement capacity stood at 109 MTPA.

title: Top Gainers & Losers on Jan 30: Hindustan Zinc, Vedanta, Hindustan Copper, Swiggy, Tata Steel among top losers today
summary: The Indian stock market fell on January 30, driven by heavy selling in metal stocks and ongoing weakness in technology shares. This led to significant losses, despite some gains in media, FMCG, and real estate sectors.

title: Warren Buffett sheds light on mistakes investors make while trying to get rich: ‘Terrible mistake to think…’
summary: Taking a reference from late baseball pro Ted Williams' book, Buffett said that there are ‘no called strikes’ in investing. Here's what the billionaire said about the mistakes investors make while trying to get rich over time.

title: ₹28 to  ₹232: Multibagger infra stock trumps US tariffs, gives over 700% return since last budget
summary: The multibagger stock was down nearly 2% to  ₹232 in Friday's trading session amid a stock market crash ahead of the Union Budget 2026

title: Sensex, Nifty 50 snap three-day winning run ahead of Union Budget 2026— 10 key highlights
summary: Stock market today: The Sensex ended the day with a loss of 297 points, or 0.36%, at 82,269.78, while the Nifty 50 settled at 25,320.65, down 98 points, or 0.39%.

title: MCX gold, silver prices crash up to 15% as panic selling grips investors: Time to buy, sell or hold?
summary: The sharp selloff that engulfed the precious metals market on Friday extended during the afternoon trade, with gold and silver futures on the MCX plunging up to 15%.

title: NALCO Q3 Results: Net profit rises marginally to  ₹1,595.15 crore;  ₹4.5 interim dividend declared
summary: NALCO Q3: National Aluminium Company reported a consolidated net profit of  ₹1,595.15 crore for Q3 FY26, a 1.8% increase from last year. The Board approved a second interim dividend of  ₹4.50 per share, with a record date of February 6, 2026.

title: Amazon mulls $50 billion investment in OpenAI, report says. What’s in it for both.
summary: Amazon is in talks to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI, as part of an overall fund-raising round to raise up to $100 billion, The Wall Street Journal reported.

title: CARE Ratings revises Vodafone Idea outlook to ‘Positive’ on AGR relief, capex plan
summary: CARE noted that while the AGR deferral significantly reduces near-to-medium-term cash outflows, spectrum-related dues are likely to increase sharply from FY28 onwards. The company’s ability to meet these obligations will depend on the timely execution of network capex, tariff hikes, and operating leverage-led improvement in cash flows.

title: SBI General Insurance 9M FY26 gross direct premium grows 15%, PAT at Rs 522 crore
summary: SBI General Insurance reported strong financial performance in 9M FY26, with gross direct premium growth of 14.5% and PAT of Rs 522 crore. Improved loss ratio and healthy solvency underscore operational strength and disciplined risk management.

title: Accretion Nutraveda IPO: Last day to buy the SME IPO - check GMP, subscription status, and other details
summary: Accretion Nutraveda's IPO opened on January 28, showing weak subscription with a closing date of January 30. The company aims to raise  ₹24.77 crore, primarily for capacity expansion. The IPO was subscribed 1.83x by Day 3, with retail portion at 2.19x.

title: FPIs take a bearish call in the run-up to Budget
summary: The shorting of over 1.3 lakh Nifty and Bank Nifty call options &nbsp;ahead of the event is on anticipation of either corrective to flat markets , which will enable them to retain money paid by retail HNIs&nbsp;

title: Bajaj Auto Q3 results: Profit jumps 25% YoY to  ₹2,750 crore
summary: Bajaj Auto Q3 results: Profit jumps 25% YoY to  ₹2,749.82 crore

title: US Fed Chairman LIVE Updates: Donald Trump set to replace Jerome Powell — Who is next Federal Reserve Chairman?
summary: US Fed Chairman LIVE Updates: All eyes are now on US President Donald Trump, who is set to announce the name of the new Federal Reserve Chairman who will succeed Chair Jerome Powell amid the federal government's plea for further rate cuts for the US economy.

title: Budget 2026: MCX, NCDEX to stay open on Sunday, February 1. Check timings
summary: MCX, NCDEX, NSE and BSE will open for a special Sunday trading session on February 1 during the Union Budget 2026, marking only the second time Indian markets trade on a Sunday, with standard timings and live market activity.

title: Budget 2026: Indian stock market to stay open on Sunday, February 1 — only the second time in history
summary: Indian stock markets will open on Sunday, February 1, 2026, for the Union Budget — only the second Sunday trading session in independent India. Exchanges will follow regular hours as FM Nirmala Sitharaman presents Budget 2026. Historically, Budget days see muted market moves, with bigger trends emerging afterwards.

title: Stock market and taxes: Why Nithin Kamath is leaning towards lower STT ahead of Budget 2026
summary: Nithin Kamath warns higher derivatives STT hurt trading and revenues. He says post-2024 tax hikes reduced volumes as markets cooled, causing STT collections to trail estimates, suggesting sharply higher transaction costs can be counterproductive for market participation and government receipts.

title: Gainers & Losers: Vodafone among 7 big movers on Friday. Here’s what triggered them
summary: Indian equity benchmarks snapped a three-day rally on Friday amid selling in metals and IT. Hindustan Copper and Vedanta fell sharply, while Vodafone Idea, Nestle India and GRSE gained following earnings, management updates and strategic announcements.

title: Paytm stock is down more than 14% from highs, trading below crucial short-term averages; time to buy or sell?
summary: Paytm stock has fallen over 14% from December highs, trading below key short-term averages. Experts suggest a sell-on-rise strategy with short positions in the 1,230–1,200 zone, targeting Rs 1,030, while technical indicators signal weakening momentum.

title: Rupee rebounds from record low of 92.02 to end marginally higher against US dollar
summary: At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened at 91.89 and gained ground, touching 91.82 against the greenback during intraday trade. The currency touched its lowest-ever level of 92.02 before ending the session at 91.97 against the dollar.

summary: NTPC Q3 results: Net profit rises over 8% YoY to  ₹5,597 crore; second interim dividend of  ₹2.75/share declared

title: Why fiscal policy matters more than monetary policy for bond yield currently
summary: Elevated yields in developed markets, including the US, Japan and the UK, also create spill-over pressures for emerging market bonds, including India.

title: A West Delhi unicorn: Shiprocket's Saahil Goel on the long road to building India’s logistics backbone
summary: Saahil Goel, inspired by his early tech experiences, co-founded Shiprocket to empower small businesses in India. The company evolved through various challenges to become a logistics backbone for e-commerce, ensuring efficient delivery and payments, and supporting over 200,000 businesses.

title: Trump nominates Kevin Warsh for Federal Reserve chair to succeed Jerome Powell
Stock picks of the week: 5 stocks with consistent score improvement and upside potential of up to 33%
summary: In terms of indices like the Nifty and Sensex, what needs to be watched is whether market breadth recovers. And that is where Budget 2026 may play an important role. The key will be to look at how the government attempts to put economic growth back on track. Even the government realises that it was its own spending that was driving growth. Will it now try and encourage greater capital expenditure by the private sector? Our selected stocks today depict a strong upward trajectory in their overall average score, which is based on five key pillars – earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum. This implies that there has been a significant improvement in their market outlook in the given time frame.

title: Multibagger stock trumps tariff and trade war, turns  ₹1 lakh into  ₹4.7 lakh since last budget
summary: The Indian stock market faced volatility post-Budget, yet Synthiko Foils thrived with a 363% gain in share price since the last Union Budget. The stock has generated 4,000% returns over five years, significantly boosting investor wealth, particularly among retail investors holding a 34.2% stake.

title: NSE IPO: Sebi issues no-objection certificate
summary: Sebi's NoC puts an end to nine years of waiting for NSE's initial public offering (IPO).

title: Meesho bets on logistics fixes, operating leverage to lift margins after Q3 loss widens
summary: The e-commerce marketplace plans to accelerate investments in advertising and sales promotion to support new user additions as well as expand its non-technology talent in the rest of FY26.

title: IBM takes Gurugram office on 10-year lease for  ₹180 crore
summary: IBM India leased 230,000 sq. ft at Intellion Park in Gurugram for ten years at a monthly rent of  ₹1.25 crore, escalating by 15% every three years.

title: Ola Electric to lay off 5% of workforce as part of restructuring effort, says report
summary: Ola Electric reportedly announced a 5% workforce reduction as part of its restructuring efforts, focusing on increased automation to create a leaner organisation for long-term growth.
